title: 106_s630
content: TRANSFER OF RESPONSIBILITY FOR OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE FLATHEAD IRRIGATION PROJECT, MONTANA. The purpose of this Act is to preserve family farms and ranches in the Jocko Valley, Camas Valley, and Mission Valley, Montana by transferring responsibility for the Flathead Irrigation Project without affecting water rights negotiations. Definitions include "contract" and "irrigation district." The curr_chunk defines key terms related to the Flathead Irrigation Project, including "irrigation district," "project," "Secretary," and "Tribe." The curr_chunk specifies that the Secretary must offer a contract to the irrigation district within a year for managing the Flathead Irrigation Project, including trust responsibilities. The Secretary must offer a contract to the irrigation district within a year for managing the Flathead Irrigation Project, including trust responsibilities and ensuring maintenance of instream flows for fisheries. The Bureau of Indian Affairs establishes interim instream flows to preserve fisheries pending water rights adjudication. Obligations for project construction costs repayment continue unaffected by the Act if the irrigation district makes a $1,000,000 accelerated payment by December 31, 2001. This Act does not affect the negotiation of water rights between the State of Montana, the United States, and the Tribe.
